content:
Hi All, I have a doctor's appointment around the meeting time. I will try to catch up on my phone if and when I get time. I have been editing some of the text this morning in the doc and ended up adding some of the answers by @mark-i-m et. al. to my questions in the doc itself.

I believe the section of Generics/Substitution is really in need for a lot of editing.

Also, what is "Morally"?
cool, I need to go over the document again, unsure when I will be able but it will happen soon :), maybe next week
@WG-learning meeting in 13 minutes
@WG-learning :wave:
:wave:
so ... since last meeting until this one I have not gone again over the ty document we were preparing
plan to do so next week and start to cook the corresponding PR
all I've done this week for this WG is going through PRs and issues
do you have some news to share?
I don't have much to discuss either, unsure about you @Yuki Okushi and @Tshepang Lekhonkhobe and others attending?
I've nothing to share really
also on nov 26th we will have a bigger planning meeting
compiler team, or just our wg?
our wg
more info #t-compiler/wg-learning > roadmap / planning meeting?
year, saw that... lemme remind self
@Yuki Okushi do you have some news to share or something to ask or say? :)
nothing!
ok

more info #t-compiler/wg-learning > roadmap / planning meeting?

take a look at this and if you have some comments or questions we can continue discussing in this meeting, otherwise I guess we can call it a day :)
am also concerned by slow progress, and I am guilty, but I guess this will be part of discussion on that planning meeting
I suppose we'll have the ty chapter ready by next meeting?
perhaps we'll then choose the next lecture to look at

am also concerned by slow progress, and I am guilty, but I guess this will be part of discussion on that planning meeting

this is exactly what this kind of meetings are be for too
to also discuss ideas to improve
I understand your concern and I'd like to improve too, unsure exactly how
also I think it would be nice to give time for different approaches to settle a bit
am also feeling bad for the polonius lecture, but was partly discouraged by it being obsolete now (interface has changed)
ahh ya, that kind of stuff can happen
I meant, don't feel bad for yourself
I'm more interested in discussing slow progress as a group
because personally we all have different things to do and it's hard to find time to invest
this is more or less why we ended switching to this idea of going all together after one chapter
and I think in some sense it worked well
meetings also see little attendance... maybe people forget (other than those that excuse selves)

and I think in some sense it worked well

yeah, shared lectures are a great idea

meetings also see little attendance... maybe people forget (other than those that excuse selves)

well I'm not sure about that neither, my feeling is that meetings are happening too frequently given the amount of progress we are able to do

well I'm not sure about that neither, my feeling is that meetings are happening too frequently given the amount of progress we are able to do

exactly
you are making me wonder if we should even have meetings at all
yeah, maybe we can discuss about this during the big planning meeting, I'm all for doing this async
I don't see the need right now for meetings
we can have sync meetings when needed
yeah, kool
we'll still have one 2 weeks from now as usual?
let's cancel these meetings until we have the planning, we can decide what to do there
agreed
we should probably start a planning document async and fill with what we want to discuss
looks like I won't make it to that meeting actually
... will be away on vacation
I can participate in the shared doc
I enjoyed dropbox paper, nifty tech
I'm writing some planning ideas
will share in a bit
actually let me share the link on a different topic
Hmm... interesting idea... we could just create a zulip stream for each issue we want to discuss and just ping the WG at the top. People can chime in when they have a chance...

Hmm... interesting idea... we could just create a zulip stream for each issue we want to discuss and just ping the WG at the top. People can chime in when they have a chance...

which idea are you referring to?
